column4: hey, I tried to install ubuntu on my laptop, but when I booted the cd, I got a message that said that there is no access to the tty, and that the job controll is off. . . .anyone know anything about that?
It happenned before ubuntu was able to boot into X

It may be a bug which would turn up under a google search for your hardware and ubuntu or tyr this..   At start or install press F6 and remove Quiet and Splash from the command line. If it still fails repeat and add noapic acpi=off before the "--"
I tried the F6 approach. I didnt find much on "Ubuntu on an aspire2920". I didnt quite get how to turn off the splash and the quiet options...
